page.title: 02THE PHOENIX OF FLEETWOOD
page.content: In the initial gloom of the post- cod-war era, Fleetwood suffered as does a mining village whose mines are closed. Fishermen no longer fished, and families once separated by sea but joined in prosperity were now united in despair. Then the phenomenon of the container port appeared, and with that a chance for new work for Fleetwood and fresh hope for its people. Apart from the shipowners, the I.C.I. had been the key employers of the townspeople. Soon Pandoro was to be an employer and the Buffalo container ship welcome in place of the fishing fleet. Now, in 1985, Fleetwood is showing signs of new confidence and new growth. Thanks to Fleetwood's namesake and originator, it has always been blessed with fine, wide streets, and recent developments are restoring its civic pride as a sea-side resort.
